Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110411 Firefox/4.2a1pre

When the menu bar is hidden and the bookmark sidebar is enabled, the keyboard shortcut (ALT+S) does not open the History menu.

Reproducible: always

Prerequisites:
Make sure that the Menu Bar is hidden.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the bookmarks sidebar from: View -> Sidebar -> Bookmarks or by pressing CTRL+B
2. Invoke the History Menu using the keyboard shortcut: ALT+S.

Actual Results:
When hitting ALT+S the focus is switched to the search bar in the Bookmarks sidebar.

Expected Results:
The History Menu is opened.
comments.creator: simona.marcu@softvision.com

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110412 Firefox/4.2a1pre

When the Menu-bar is hidden the menu can still be accessed using the ALT+S shortcut (as well as all the other shortcuts ALT +F/E/V etc). When the sidebar is displayed (either History or Bookmarks) the ALT+S shortcut comes into conflict with the search bar from within the sidebar.
